title: Joffrey Lake Hiking: A Complete Trail Guide
content:
1. How to reach:

* Self driving: Lake Joffrey is located approximately 35 kilometers east of Pemberton, British Columbia. Go north on Highway 99 (Haitian Highway) from Vancouver, and then follow the signs at Lake Joffrey Provincial Park.

Departing from Vancouver:

Distance: Approximately 180 kilometers.

Duration: Approximately 2.5 to 3 hours, depending on traffic and weather conditions.

Route: Drive west along Highway 1 (Trans Canada Highway) to Horseshoe Bay, then turn onto Highway 99 and head north (Haitian Highway) to Skomish and Whistler. Continue along Highway 99 through Pemberton.

Departing from Whistler:

Distance: Approximately 65 kilometers.

Duration: Approximately 1 hour.

Route: Starting from Whistler, drive north along Highway 99, passing through Pemberton. Continue driving along Highway 99 until you see the sign for Lake Joffrey Provincial Park.

* Starting from Pemberton:

Distance: Approximately 35 kilometers.

Duration: Approximately 30 minutes.

Route: Drive along Highway 99 from Pemberton East. Along this route, you can clearly see the starting point of the trail towards Lake Joffrey.

Parking Lot

Parking Lot: There is a parking lot at the entrance of the Joffrey Lake Trail, but it can quickly fill up, especially on weekends and during summer. It is recommended to arrive early in the morning to ensure availability of parking spaces.

Overflow parking spaces: During peak hours, there may be overflow parking spaces, but it is best to arrive as early as possible to avoid any inconvenience.



2. Hiking route:

*Lower Joffrey Lake: This is the easiest of the three lakes in the park to reach. The path to Lower Joffrey Lake is moderately difficult, with a 5-kilometer round-trip hike. Along the way, you can enjoy the magnificent scenery of the emerald green seawater and surrounding mountains.

*Zhongqiao Fuli Lake: Continue your adventure and head to Zhongqiao Fuli Lake, which is a more challenging 3-kilometer journey starting from Xiaqiao Fuli Lake. Be amazed by the glacial lake and prepare to climb the steep upper lake.

*Upper Joffrey Lake: For the most adventurous individuals, the path to Upper Joffrey Lake will take you 5 kilometers from Middle Joffrey Lake to the clear waters beneath the majestic Matil Glacier.


3. Hiker tips:

*Address: Pemberton Lake Joffrey Provincial Park, British Columbia, Canada

*Admission fee: Free

*Opening hours: Open year-round, but conditions vary with the season. The daytime is most suitable for hiking.

*Best travel time: Late June to early October, when there is usually no snow on the path and the lakes are most active.

*Length: Approximately 10 kilometers (6.2 miles) round-trip

*Time: 3 to 5 hours, depending on your pace and duration of stay in each lake

*Packing essentials: Be sure to bring enough water, snacks, sunscreen, and multiple layers of clothing, as weather conditions in mountainous areas can change quickly.

*Leave No Trace: Adhere to the principle of leaving no trace and help protect the natural beauty of the park. Take away all garbage and respect the habitats of wildlife.

*Check the condition of the path: Before departure, please check the updates and status of the path, especially in winter, as ice and snow may make hiking difficult.



4. Camping options:

Joffrey Lake Campsite: There is a first come, first served campsite near the entrance of the trail, suitable for those who want to extend their stay and further explore the area. Remember to obtain all necessary licenses in advance.



5. Photography skills:

*Golden Moment: At sunrise or sunset, when the surrounding mountains are bathed in golden light, capture the stunning scenery of Xiafei Lake.

*Reflection: Searching for calm moments on the lake, capturing the vibrant turquoise waters and the mirror reflections of rugged peaks.
section: From exploring scenic paths to immersing yourself in magnificent scenery, unlock the key to the wonders waiting for you in this natural oasis. Therefore, as you embark on an unforgettable wilderness journey, breathe fresh mountain air, feel the crunching sound of gravel underfoot, and let the beauty of Lake Joffre captivate your senses. Get ready to leave unforgettable memories at Lake Joffre - the magnificence of nature knows no bounds.
